title: Captaining Great Britain is a real honour and I can't help but look back to the start of my journey
text:
Great Britain is back after a 12-year absence and, while I am looking forward to facing Tonga this weekend, I cannot help but look back on my international debut.

It was a Tuesday night in June 2006 against New Zealand and I came off the bench to score twice in a 46-14 win at Knowsley Road, of all places.

That was pretty surreal for me as a 20-year-old St Helens player who had grown up supporting the club.

I was a bag of nerves beforehand because, although I played my club rugby with the likes of Keiron Cunningham, Sean Long and Paul Sculthorpe, this was a huge step up.

Fortunately my good friend Paul Wellens was there and aimed a little joke at me which, looking back, helped to settle me down. I really appreciated that.

Myself and a few of the other Saints lads went for a couple of drinks afterwards and I was getting plenty of pats on the back - I was on a massive high.

My parents, John and Diane, were there that night and have supported me every step of the way.

I am from Maghull in Liverpool, which is a huge football area and I'm a big Evertonian.
description: Great Britain is back after a 12-year absence and, while I am looking forward to facing Tonga this weekend, I cannot help but look back on my international debut.
